meanings.definition: A person who signs a negotiable instrument, such as a check, to transfer ownership to another party.
meanings.sent1: The indorsers of the check were required to provide their signatures.
meanings.sent2: The bank required all indorsers to sign the document before processing the transaction.
meanings.sent3: The indorsers decided to have a signing competition to see who had the best signature.
meanings.sent4: The indorsers' signatures danced across the check like graceful ballerinas.
meanings.sent5: The indorsers' signatures were as unique as snowflakes, each one telling a different story.

meanings.definition: Those who support or advocate for a particular cause or idea.
meanings.sent1: The indorsers of the charity event worked tirelessly to raise funds.
meanings.sent2: The indorsers of the new policy voiced their opinions at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The indorsers organized a bake sale to support their cause.
meanings.sent4: The indorsers stood united like a wall of support for their idea.
meanings.sent5: The indorsers' dedication shone brightly, inspiring others to join their cause.
